dt: {bc}to provide, cover with, or surround with or as if with a wall
{bc}to separate by or as if by a wall

dt.t: {wi}walled{/wi} the monster up within the tomb

dt: {bc}to close (an opening) with or as if with a wall

shortdef: to provide, cover with, or surround with or as if with a wall
to separate by or as if by a wall

dt: {bc}to roll (one's eyes) in a dramatic manner

et: Middle English (Scots) {it}wawlen{/it}, probably from Middle English {it}wawil-{/it} (in {it}wawil-eghed{/it} walleyed)
shortdef: to roll in a dramatic manner
to roll (one's eyes) in a dramatic manner

dt: {bc}to surround (something) with a wall or with something that is like a wall

dt.t: They {it}walled{/it} the garden {it}in{/it} with rows of thick shrubs.

shortdef: to surround (something) with a wall or with something that is like a wall

dt: {bc}to separate (something) from the area around it with a wall

dt.t: The school {it}walled off{/it} the playground from the parking lot.

shortdef: to separate (something) from the area around it with a wall

dt: {bc}to close off (an opening) by filling it with stone, brick, etc.

dt.t: They {it}walled up{/it} the doorway of the abandoned house.

dt: {bc}to keep (someone) as a prisoner in an enclosed space

dt.t: He was {it}walled up{/it} in the tower.

shortdef: to close off (an opening) by filling it with stone, brick, etc.
to keep (someone) as a prisoner in an enclosed space
